Package persistence.dao.mongodb

Class AbstractMongoDao<T extends Entity<T>>

java.lang.Object
persistence.dao.mongodb.AbstractMongoDao<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The entity class which extends the Entity interface.
All Implemented Interfaces:
Dao<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvertisingMongoDao, BottleMongoDao, CellarMongoDao, CompanyMongoDao, ConversationMongoDao, EventMongoDao, GuideMongoDao, NotificationMongoDao, PartnerMongoDao, RateMongoDao, ReferencingMongoDao, SampleMongoDao, UserMongoDao
public abstract class AbstractMongoDao<T extends Entity<T>> extends Object implements Dao<T>
DAO abstract class which implements the DAO interface with generic methods. The methods can be overridden in the concrete DAO classes. This DAO uses mongoDB as a database.

    • findAllWithFilter

      public List<T> findAllWithFilter(org.bson.BsonDocument filter) throws NotFoundException
      Find all entities of the parametrized type in the database that match the filter given in parameter.
      Parameters:
      filter - The filter to apply. Example : BsonDocument filter = new BsonDocument(); filter.append("username", new org.bson.BsonString(username));
      Returns:
      A list of entities.
      Throws:
      NotFoundException - If no entity is returned.

    • addOrRemoveFromSet

      protected org.bson.types.ObjectId addOrRemoveFromSet(org.bson.types.ObjectId collectionId, Object o, String field, boolean add) throws BadArgumentsException
      Add or remove from a set in a given MongoCollection
      Parameters:
      collectionId - the collection to insert or remove from.
      o - the object to insert or remove.
      field - the field to insert or remove from.
      add - true to add, false to remove.
      Returns:
      the object id of the updated collection if the update was successful, otherwise throws a BadArgumentsException.
      Throws:
      BadArgumentsException

    • getSetOnUpdate

      protected abstract org.bson.conversions.Bson getSetOnUpdate(T entity)
      Function used in updateOne() to set the fields to update. Must be implemented in the child class.
      Returns:
      the Bson object to use in updateOne(). Must be something like this : Updates.combine( Updates.set("runtime", 99), Updates.addToSet("genres", "Sports"), Updates.currentTimestamp("lastUpdated"));
